result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dell Lavon Cornelius Brown

records.addlTxt: 10:10 AM Defendant Dell Lavon Cornelius Brown in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael A. Forella III appeared by phone for Dell Lavon Cornelius Brown.  Attorney Joel N Urmanski in court for State of Wisconsin. State is in compliance w/victim's rights. Plea questionnaire efiled. Court does plea colloquy w/defendant and advised of rights. State moves to DRI this entire case w/global resolution. Defendant makes a statement. Court orders this case DRI in it's entirety.
Letter to the Judge from Atty. Forella III re:  Person Appearance Request

11:37 AM Defendant Dell Lavon Cornelius Brown appeared by phone, in custody.  Attorney Michael A. Forella III appeared by phone for Dell Lavon Cornelius Brown.  Attorney Joel N Urmanski appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. Jail recommendation consecutive to each other and prison sentence, 4th case is w/Atty Mayer, Court not familiar with the 4th case, Atty Forella states 4th case a felony and plan is to take that case to trial. State is not sure where Atty Mayer is on his case (4th case) and would redact global offer as offer is for a global. Atty Forella would like to resolve all 3 misd cases but does not object to a new date to see where all cases are and will reach out to Atty Mayer.
Plea hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Plea hearing on October 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Plea hearing on September 13, 2022 at 11:30 am.

4:04 PM Defendant Dell Lavon Cornelius Brown appeared by phone, in custody.  Attorney Joan Korb appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Michael A. Forella III appeared by phone for Dell Lavon Cornelius Brown. 950/Marsy's Law complied with. Working on global resolution.
Plea hearing scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 11:30 am.

9:30 AM Attorney Joel N Urmanski appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Michael A. Forella III appeared by phone for Dell Lavon Cornelius Brown. 
Atty Forella left client voicemail last week and he left a message in return.950/Marsy's Law complied with. Atty Forella will trying calling deft but believes he is in custody. 
9:41 AM Defendant Dell Lavon Cornelius Brown appeared by phone, in custody.  Attorney Joel N Urmanski appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Michael A. Forella III appeared by phone for Dell Lavon Cornelius Brown. Deft now on conf line from the Det Ctr. Atty Forella states a global resolution but not sure State wants to extend offer to include new case 22CF262 - Br2 and hoping Public Defenders Office will appoint him on new case. Court explains after the preliminary hearing an official assignment to have new case come to Br3.
Status conference scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
